mr. Obama and many of his political
contemporaries represent what many see
as a new type of black politician they
are leading the generation of African
Americans who came of age after the
Civil Rights Movement
one trait that this group shares is a
message that is often more moderate than

they have been remarkably successful at

without its pitfalls as much of the

community there are generational
cleavages to be overcome these men have
the ambition and the ability to run for
state and national office but some older
African Americans want to hear race play
a more central role in their rhetoric
while others believe that the country is
quote not ready for a black president
this variety of concerns has led a
